title: Installation issue: superlu-mt using nvhpc for BLAS/possibly nvhpc +blas issue???
body:
I am attempting to build superlu-mt +blas %nvhpc using nvhpc+blas as the provider for BLAS, but the build is failing due to undefined references to various aio_* symbols.  Thus does not occur when I try an otherwise identical build for superlu-mt~blas.

In debugging, I see that spack's nvhpc recipe  adds -lnvf to the compilation lines when using LAPACK from nvhpc, which has the various aio_* symbols.  And if I try to manually compile some simple Lapack example codes, I am required to link in libnvf.so and then librt.so.

As a test, I hacked the superlu-mt recipe to add the -lrt flag when building if the blas provider is nvhpc, then I can successfully build the package.

While I could simply do that (or add libaio as a dependency for superlu-mt when blas provider is nvhpc), I am unsure if that is the proper solution.
1) This seems to be a nvhpc+lapack issue, as the libnvf.so library (part of nvhpc) being added when nvhpc's lapack is used has a dependency on the aio library, and I think that this should be fixed in nvhpc, not in every package depending on lapack or blas.

2) I see spack has its own libaio package, so I _think_ it should be linking against that and not the system installed one via -lrt.  But I am not 100% sure, as even when spack "builds" nvhpc, it is not really building it but just wrapping a binary install.

3) If the proper solution is to have the -lrt flag added whenever a package is built using nvhpc as the BLAS provider, I am unsure how to modify the nvhpc package to accomplish that.

4) I can add libaio as a dependency to nvhpc, but that did not seem to do the trick (although that could possibly be because I am using an nvhpc declared as an external package to spack).

Advice would be appreciated.

### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
$ spack install superlu-mt@3.1%nvhpc " +blas~int64+openmp+pic~pthread
...
/software/spack/git.2021.04.28/lib/spack/env/nvhpc/nvc -mp -D__OPENMP -fpic -DAdd_ -I../SRC -c sp_ienv.c
/software/spack/git.2021.04.28/lib/spack/env/nvhpc/nvc -mp -fpic psdrive.o sp_sconvert.o psgst01.o psgst02.o psgst04.o psgst07.o psgssv.o psgssvx.o sp_ienv.o \
libtmglib.a ../lib/libsuperlu_mt_OPENMP.a -L/software/nvhpc/21.5/linux-rhel8-x86_64/Linux_x86_64/21.5/compilers/lib -lblas -llapack -lnvf -lm -mp -o pstest
/software/nvhpc/21.5/linux-rhel8-x86_64/Linux_x86_64/21.5/compilers/lib/libnvf.so: undefined reference to `aio_return'
/software/nvhpc/21.5/linux-rhel8-x86_64/Linux_x86_64/21.5/compilers/lib/libnvf.so: undefined reference to `aio_read'
/software/nvhpc/21.5/linux-rhel8-x86_64/Linux_x86_64/21.5/compilers/lib/libnvf.so: undefined reference to `aio_error'
/software/nvhpc/21.5/linux-rhel8-x86_64/Linux_x86_64/21.5/compilers/lib/libnvf.so: undefined reference to `aio_write'
/software/nvhpc/21.5/linux-rhel8-x86_64/Linux_x86_64/21.5/compilers/lib/libnvf.so: undefined reference to `aio_suspend'
```

### Information on your system

```console
$spack debug report
* **Spack:** 0.16.1-2429-f5e6c32495
* **Python:** 3.6.8
* **Platform:** linux-rhel8-x86_64
* **Concretizer:** original
```

As previously mentioned, I am using an manually installed nvhpc@21.5 defined as an external package to spack, i.e.
```console
  nvhpc:
    version: [21.5]
    variants: +blas install_type=single +lapack +mpi
    compiler:: [nvc@21.5]
    buildable: false
    externals:
        - spec: 'nvhpc@21.5 %nvhpc@21.5 +blas install_type=single +lapack +mpi'
          prefix: /software/nvhpc/21.5/linux-rhel8-x86_64/
```

This is because if I install nvhpc using spack, spack needs a compiler to install it with (even though there is no actual compilation), and then when I attempt to use nvhpc as a provider for blas, etc., spack tries to install again using the nvhpc compiler.

* [spack-build-env.txt](https://github.com/spack/spack/files/6871416/spack-build-env.txt)
